Docs.summary: Contains arguments relevant to all drag-and-drop events (, , , and ).

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property AllowedEffects As DragDropEffects
public: property System::Windows::DragDropEffects AllowedEffects { System::Windows::DragDropEffects get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets a member of the enumeration that specifies which operations are allowed by the originator of the drag event.
Docs.value: A member of the enumeration that specifies which operations are allowed by the originator of the drag event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When a drag-and-drop operation is initiated by calling the <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.DoDragDrop%2A> method, permissible operations are specified with a member of the <xref:System.Windows.DragDropEffects> enumeration. For example, when dragging a read-only file the drag initiator should indicate that the file can be copied, but not moved. Before attempting to perform an operation on dragged data, examine this property to ensure that the operation is allowed.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the target drag-and-drop operation.
Docs.value: A member of the enumeration specifying the target drag-and-drop operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks By default, the effect specified in this property determines the mouse cursor for the target of a drag-and-drop operation. This is useful to provide feedback to the user on the operation that will occur when the corresponding object is dropped.

Public ReadOnly Property KeyStates As DragDropKeyStates
public: property System::Windows::DragDropKeyStates KeyStates { System::Windows::DragDropKeyStates get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets a flag enumeration indicating the current state of the SHIFT, CTRL, and ALT keys, as well as the state of the mouse buttons.
Docs.value: One or more members of the flag enumeration.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The effect of a drag-and-drop operation can be adjusted depending on the state of a particular key. For example, data may either be copied or moved depending on whether the CTRL or SHIFT keys are pressed during the drag-and-drop operation.
